title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: There was a farm called Connachan down towards Monzie where we used to go for tea when we were meant to be up at the top of the hill.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: We got out there a moment to look at the very finehouse he is building, then drove home by Monzie(Campbell of Monzie's), and Sir W. Murray's,and had a very good view of the Highland hills —a very fine day.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: Campbell of Monzie (pronounced"Monie"), a young gentleman who has a placenear here, went with him and was, Albert said,extremely active.
